metadata.Title: CVE-2023-42754 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel ipv4 stack.The socket buffer (skb) was assumed to be associated with a device beforecalling __ip_options_compile, which is not always the case if the skb isre-routed by ipvs. This issue may allow a local user with CAP_NET_ADMINprivileges to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42754` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1125.131
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1172-azure - 4.15.0-1172.187~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.131').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1172.187~14.04.1').
